title: What are the primary differences between megalomaniac traits and narcissistic personality traits? - Quora

response.answer_text: KInd of splitting atoms on this one. Megalomaniac traits are generally just a term that happens to combine many of the traits we find with NPD. They don’t comprehensively cover all of them but they are largely the same. Megalomania is a ‘delusional mental illness’ on a Google search. I use that term very loosely as you won’t find it in any official resources nor is it a diagnosable condition. On the ‘internet of things’ however it is marked by feelings of personal omnipotence and grandeur. Even Wikipedia redirects to NPD. I would consider it a word simplifying via a single word or label a number of the common traits and characteristics of NPD but nothing I would use in an official way. Thank you for the A2A

not all people have all 9 traits of npd, when they do then they are considered a megalomaniac, you have a malignant narcissist with serious psychopathic personality. these are your dictator types, very driven by power and control over others and not many typical narcissists want “remote neural monitoring”
